page.title: 15BUILDINGS (STURTON HAMLETS)
page.content: {BROXHOLME: ALL SAINTS CHURCH (GRADE 11 LISTED) IS IN DECORATIVE STYLE,ROCK-FACED WITH A PERKY LITTLE TURRET SOUTH OF THE WEST GABLE. { {BRANSBY:} DIAL HOUSE IS THE OLDEST BUILDING, REPUTEDLY VISITED BY{OLIVER CROMWELL DURING THE BATTLE OF LEA (3 MILES FROM GAINSBOROUGH). THE LISTED THRESHING BARN IS OF SIMILAR AGE AND IS NOW USED FOR STORAGE. THE FOOTPATH LEADING FROM BRANSBY TO STURTON IS KNOWN AS {BUNNY WELLS LANE} NAMED AFTER OLIVER CROMWELL'S HORSE, {BUNNY. THE NONCONFORMIST CHAPEL HAS BEEN CONVERTED INTO A DWELLING HOUSE AND THE FORMER BLACKSMITH'S SHOP INTO A PRIVATE GARAGE.{ {
